oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A simple approach to bis-spirocycles and spiroindole derivatives via green methods such as Fischer indolization, ring-closing metathesis, and Suzuki-Miyaura cross-coupling
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KOTHA, S
ALI, R
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: DIVERSITY-ORIENTED APPROACH
OLEFIN METATHESIS
CLAISEN REARRANGEMENT
INDOLE ALKALOIDS
NATURAL-PRODUCTS
CATALYSTS
FUNCTIONALIZATION
CHEMISTRY
LIGANDS
DESIGN
Spirocycles
Fischer indolization
ring-closing metathesis
Suzuki coupling
Grubbs' catalyst
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We have developed a simple synthetic methodology for bis-spirocycles and spiroindole derivatives starting with a commercially available 6-bromo-2-tetralone. Here, we have used Fischer indolization, ring-closing metathesis, and Suzuki Miyaura cross-coupling as key steps to assemble a variety of spirocyclic frameworks. The methodology developed here is simple and it may be useful to prepare various spirocycles containing indole moiety.
